As Graphic Designer I own the design execution for the Mashery, an Intel Company brand. This role translates the brand through key stages of production: the brief, concept building, brand protection/evolution and internationalization. Projects include online creative, contributing to marketing site design and development, creation of marketing landing pages, and asset production for online ads, email templates and sales collateral. I am responsible for designs that adhere to brand guidelines and work cross-platform and globally. Acting as a brand liaison, I work closely with product, marketing and engineering teams, and external creative agencies, to move rapidly from concept to launch, testing, and iteration. 
 
Responsibilities: 
• Translate brand strategies into creative marketing execution that will be tested,  
measured, and iterated. 
• Work collaboratively with team members to produce effective and useful web site content,including landing pages and other CMS content as well as maintain updates to multiple web properties, both with the support of graphic creation and content. 
• Produce website wireframes, site maps, user flows and other documentation in relation to  
functional requirements. 
• Conceptualize and create the visual design and layout of printed collateral, presentations,  
trade show signage, and various marketing materials based on current and future branding  
guidelines and visual identity. 
• Create vector information graphics, icons and flow charts that explain the Intel Services solution. 
• Work with the sales and marketing teams to ensure a cohesive experience for audiences  
across all design pieces.
